metadata.topic: It's time to stop hyphenating words because they don't fit in one single line.

moderator_initial_opinion:
Answer: b) Generally Disagree with the statement

Hyphenating words serves an important function in maintaining clarity and proper grammar, especially in cases where compound words or split words at the end of a line are necessary. Eliminating hyphens solely based on line length would compromise readability and adherence to linguistic rules.
